note: and Robert Adam (1728—92), but of particular importance to Runciman was Gavin Hamilton (1723—98). It is with respect to Hamilton and those he influenced that Robert Rosenblum has noted the importance of Scottish painters
title: 91) — and more generally with reference to the exploration of epic narrative themes. Scottish links with Rome at this time were well established, and Scottish artists, architects and antiquaries a decade or two older than Runciman had close links with the city
